definitions.definition: To contend in physical conflict, either singly or in war, battle etc.
definitions.example: A wounded animal will fight like a maniac, relentless, savage and murderous.

definitions.definition: To contend in physical conflict with each other, either singly or in war, battle etc.
definitions.example: The two boxers have been fighting for more than half an hour.

definitions.definition: To strive for something; to campaign or contend for success.
definitions.example: He fought for the Democrats in the last election.

definitions.definition: To conduct or engage in (battle, warfare etc.).
definitions.example: The battle was fought just over that hill.

definitions.definition: To engage in combat with; to oppose physically, to contest with.
definitions.example: My grandfather fought the Nazis in World War II.

definitions.definition: To try to overpower; to fiercely counteract.
definitions.example: The government pledged to fight corruption.

definitions.definition: To cause to fight; to manage or manoeuvre in a fight.
definitions.example: to fight cocks; to fight one's ship

definitions.definition: Of colours or other design elements: to clash; to fail to harmonize.

definitions.example: One of them got stuck in a chokehold and got stabbed to death during the fight.

definitions.definition: A physical confrontation or combat between two or more people or groups.
definitions.example: Watch your language, are you looking for a fight?

definitions.definition: A boxing or martial arts match.
definitions.example: I'm going to Nick’s to watch the big fight tomorrow night.

definitions.definition: A conflict, possibly nonphysical, with opposing ideas or forces; strife.
definitions.example: I'll put up a fight to save this company.

definitions.definition: The will or ability to fight.
definitions.example: That little guy has a bit of fight in him after all.   As soon as he saw the size of his opponent, all the fight went out of him.

definitions.definition: A screen for the combatants in ships.
